reply.question: 1. Does the app declare the collection of data?

answer.full_answer: Yes, the app declares the collection of data.

reply.analysis: The privacy policy mentions that the app collects data of the users to provide the application's functionalities, monitor security, and for further development. It also states that communication may be necessary for administration or use of the application.
reply.reference: The processing of data necessary for the provision of the functionalities of the application serves to fulfil contractual obligations. This also applies if the provision of the functions requires user authorisation. If the processing of data is not necessary for the provision of the functionalities of the application, but serves the security of the application or business interests, it is carried out on the basis of legitimate interests. URL: https://www.mindswitch.ch/eng/privacy-policy

data of the users of our application to the extent necessary to provide the users with the application and its functionalities, to monitor its security and to develop it further. Furthermore, we may contact users in compliance with the statutory provisions if communication is necessary for the purposes of administration or use of the application. In addition, we refer to the data protection information in this privacy policy with regard to the processing of user data.

reply.question: 2. If the app declares the collection of data, what type of data does it collect?

answer.full_answer: The app collects Inventory data (e.g. names, addresses), Meta/communication data (e.g. device information, IP addresses), Payment Data (e.g. bank details, invoices, payment history), and Contract data (e.g. contract object, duration, customer category).

content: Meta/communication data (e.g. device information, IP addresses)
Payment Data (e.g. bank details, invoices, payment history)
Contract data (e.g. contract object, duration, customer category)

URL: https://www.mindswitch.ch/eng/privacy-policy

reply.question: 3. Does the app declare the purpose of data collection and use?

answer.full_answer: Yes, the app declares the purpose of data collection and use.

reply.analysis: The privacy policy explicitly mentions that data of the users is collected to provide the application and its functionalities, monitor security, and for further development. It also states that users may be contacted for administration or use purposes.
reply.reference: The app declares the purpose of data collection and use to the extent necessary to provide the users with the application and its functionalities, monitor its security, and develop it further. Furthermore, users may be contacted in compliance with statutory provisions if communication is necessary for administration or use purposes. URL: https://www.mindswitch.ch/eng/privacy-policy

reply.question: 4. Can the user opt out of data collection or delete data?

answer.full_answer: Yes, the user can opt out of data collection or delete data.

reply.analysis: The privacy policy mentions the user's right to object to the processing of personal data and the right to revoke consents at any time, indicating that users can opt out of data collection or delete data.
reply.reference: You have the right to revoke consents at any time. URL: https://www.mindswitch.ch/eng/privacy-policy

between the following types of cookies:
- Temporary cookies (also known as "session cookies"): Temporary cookies are deleted at the latest after a user has left an online service and closed his or her end device (i.e. browser or mobile application).
- Permanent cookies: Permanent cookies remain stored even after the terminal device is closed. For example, the login status can be saved, or preferred content can be displayed directly when the user visits a website again. Likewise, user data collec...

reply.question: 5. Does the app share data with third parties?

answer.full_answer: No data is shared with third parties except when necessary to pursue claims or due to legal obligations.

reply.analysis: The privacy policy clearly states that data is not shared with third parties unless required for legal obligations or specific purposes such as pursuing claims.
reply.reference: This data will not be passed on to third parties unless it is necessary to pursue our claims or there is a legal obligation to do so. URL: https://www.mindswitch.ch/eng/privacy-policy

source_documents.excerpt:
login functions as well as the use of the user account, we store the IP address and the time of the respective user action. The storage is based on our legitimate interests, as well as the user's protection against misuse and other unauthorized use. This data will not be passed on to third parties unless it is necessary to pursue our claims or there is a legal obligation to do so.
Users may be informed by e-mail of information relevant to their user account, such as technical changes.

reply.question: 6. If the app shares data with third parties, what third parties does the app share data with?

answer.full_answer: The app may share data with service providers commissioned with IT tasks or providers of services and content embedded in a website

providers of services and content embedded in a website
